metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5605 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component before 5.1.4 in Oracle Virtualization allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality and integrity via vectors related to VRDE.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-dkms - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-qt - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-source - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.6-dfsg-2').
